items.question: What is the Traders Act challenge?
items.answer: The Traders Act challenge is an evaluation program designed to identify skilled traders. You'll trade a simulated account for 30 days, and if you meet our profit targets while following our risk management rules, you'll receive a funded account.

items.question: How much does the challenge cost?
items.answer: The challenge fee varies based on the account size you choose, ranging from $99 for a $5,000 account to $599 for a $100,000 account. This is a one-time fee that covers your evaluation period.

items.question: What are the profit targets?
items.answer: The profit target is 8% of your account value over the 30-day challenge period. For example, with a $10,000 account, you'll need to make $800 in profit.

items.question: What are the risk management rules?
items.answer: Our risk management rules include: maximum daily drawdown of 5%, maximum total drawdown of 10%, and no trading during major economic news events. These rules are designed to ensure you're trading responsibly.

items.question: How quickly can I get funded after passing?
items.answer: Once you successfully complete the challenge, we'll review your trading performance within 24 hours and set up your funded account. You can start trading with our capital immediately after approval.

items.question: What trading platforms can I use?
items.answer: We support MetaTrader 4, MetaTrader 5, and TradingView for our challenges and funded accounts. You can choose the platform you're most comfortable with.

items.question: What markets can I trade?
items.answer: You can trade forex pairs, commodities, indices, and cryptocurrencies. We offer a wide range of markets to suit different trading styles and strategies.

items.question: How do I get paid my profits?
items.answer: Profit payouts are processed bi-weekly via bank transfer, PayPal, or cryptocurrency. You'll receive your share of the profits based on your profit-sharing agreement, which ranges from 70% to 90% depending on your account size and performance.

rules.title: Maximum Drawdown
rules.description: Your account has a maximum drawdown limit of 2% daily and 10% total. Exceeding these limits may result in account termination.

rules.title: Stop Loss Requirement
rules.description: All trades must have a stop loss in place. Trading without proper stop losses is not permitted and may result in account review.

rules.title: Trading Hours
rules.description: Trading during major news events or low liquidity periods is discouraged. This protects against excessive volatility and slippage.

rules.title: Consistency Requirement
rules.description: Maintain consistent trading activity. Accounts with no trading activity for 30 consecutive days may be subject to review.

rules.title: Prohibited Strategies
rules.description: Certain high-risk strategies such as martingale, grid trading without proper risk management, and arbitrage are not permitted.

mastering-risk-management.title: Mastering Risk Management: A Guide for Funded Traders
mastering-risk-management.excerpt: Learn the essential risk management techniques that professional traders use to protect their capital and maximize returns.
mastering-risk-management.author: Ahmed Al-Farsi

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: Risk management is the cornerstone of successful trading. For funded traders, who are managing significant capital provided by others, mastering risk management becomes even more crucial. This comprehensive guide will explore essential risk management techniques that professional traders use to protect their capital and maximize returns.

positionSizing.title: The Foundation: Position Sizing
positionSizing.content1: Position sizing is your first line of defense against excessive losses. As a funded trader, you should never risk more than 1-2% of your account on any single trade. This means that if you have a $100,000 funded account, your maximum risk per trade should be between $1,000 and $2,000.

steps.step1: Determine your account risk (1-2% of account size)
steps.step2: Identify your stop loss in pips or points
steps.step3: Calculate your position size based on the risk per pip/point

example.title: Example Calculation
example.content:
Account Size: $100,000
Risk per Trade: 1% = $1,000
Stop Loss: 50 pips
Therefore: $1,000 ÷ 50 pips = $20 per pip
Position Size: Adjust your lot size to achieve $20 per pip

stopLoss.title: Stop Loss Strategy
stopLoss.content: Every trade must have a predetermined stop loss. This is non-negotiable. Your stop loss should be placed at a level that:

points.point3: Aligns with your risk per trade

riskReward.title: Risk-Reward Ratio
riskReward.content: Maintain a minimum risk-reward ratio of 1:2, meaning your potential profit should be at least twice your risk. This allows you to be profitable even with a win rate below 50%. For example:

points.point3: With a 40% win rate: (40% × $2,000) - (60% × $1,000) = $200 average profit per trade

drawdown.title: Drawdown Management
drawdown.content: As a funded trader, you'll typically have maximum drawdown limits. To stay well within these limits:

points.point1: Track your daily and overall drawdown
points.point2: Reduce position sizes after consecutive losses
points.point3: Take a break if you reach 50% of your maximum drawdown

points.point4: Start deviating from your trading plan

correlation.title: Correlation Risk
correlation.content: Be mindful of correlation risk when trading multiple positions. Taking several correlated trades effectively increases your position size and risk exposure. For example:

points.point1: Trading multiple forex pairs with high USD exposure
points.point2: Taking positions in both oil and CAD pairs

scaling.title: Scaling In and Out
scaling.content: Instead of entering or exiting positions all at once, consider:

points.point1: Scaling into positions to average your entry price
points.point2: Taking partial profits to secure gains
points.point3: Moving stop loss to breakeven after partial profits

time.title: Time-Based Risk Management
time.content: Different trading sessions have different risk characteristics:

points.point1: Avoid trading during major news events
points.point2: Be cautious during market opens and closes
points.point3: Adjust position sizes during volatile periods
points.point4: Consider time stops for trades not moving in your favor

conclusion.title: Conclusion
conclusion.content: Risk management is what separates successful funded traders from those who fail. By implementing these strategies and maintaining strict discipline, you can protect your funded account and build a sustainable trading career. Remember, your first goal as a funded trader should be capital preservation, followed by consistent growth.

items.question: How do I join the Traders Act affiliate program?
items.answer: To join our affiliate program, simply register for an affiliate account on this page. Once approved, you'll receive your unique referral link and access to our affiliate dashboard.

items.question: How are referrals tracked?
items.answer: Referrals are tracked using cookies with a 90-day attribution window. This means that if someone clicks your link and signs up within 90 days, you'll receive the commission.

items.question: Can I promote Traders Act on social media?
items.answer: Yes, you can promote Traders Act on social media platforms, your website, blog, or through email marketing. We provide a variety of marketing materials to help you with your promotions.

items.question: What is the commission structure?

items.question: Is there a limit to how much I can earn?

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our trading challenge and funding program

items.question: What is the Traders Act challenge?
items.answer: The Traders Act challenge is an evaluation program designed to identify skilled traders. You'll trade on a simulated account with virtual funds, following specific rules and targets. Upon successful completion, you'll receive a funded trading account with real capital.

items.question: How long do I have to complete the challenge?
items.answer: You have up to 30 calendar days to complete the challenge. There's no minimum trading days - you can complete the challenge faster if you reach the profit target while following all trading rules.

items.question: Which markets can I trade during the challenge?
items.answer: You can trade forex, indices, commodities, and cryptocurrencies. Our platform provides access to all major global markets with competitive spreads and excellent execution.

items.question: What are the trading rules during the challenge?
items.answer: Key rules include maintaining proper position sizing (maximum 5% per trade), using stop losses, avoiding trading during major news events, and staying within maximum loss limits. Complete rules are provided when you start the challenge.

items.question: What happens after I pass the challenge?
items.answer: Once successful, you'll receive a funded account with real capital within 24-48 hours. You can then begin trading with our capital while keeping up to 90% of the profits you generate.

items.question: How frequently are profits paid out?
items.answer: We process profit payouts bi-weekly. Once your payout is approved, you'll receive the funds within 1-2 business days via your chosen payment method.
